meanings.definition: A tradition that opposes or goes against another tradition.
meanings.sent1: The countertradition of celebrating Halloween in spring confused everyone.
meanings.sent2: The countertradition of wearing pajamas to work was not well-received.
meanings.sent3: The countertradition of eating dessert before the main course raised a few eyebrows.
meanings.sent4: Her love for rock music was a countertradition to her family's classical music preference.
meanings.sent5: The countertradition of starting the day with dessert was certainly unique.

meanings.sent1: The countertradition of having a picnic on New Year's Day was a refreshing change.
meanings.sent2: The countertradition of sending handmade cards instead of store-bought ones was appreciated by many.
meanings.sent3: The countertradition of wearing sunglasses at night made him stand out in the crowd.
meanings.sent4: Her countertradition of planting flowers in the winter symbolized hope in adversity.
meanings.sent5: The countertradition of celebrating birthdays with acts of kindness was heartwarming.
